However, its architecture is quite universal and it is not limited to this kind of applications only.

description: ElastiCache is a web service that makes it easy to deploy, operate, and scale an in-memory cache in the cloud. The service improves the performance of web applications by allowing you to retrieve information from fast, managed, in-memory caches, instead of relying entirely on slower disk-based databases. Supports Memcached and Redis.

description: Amazon Elastic MapReduce uses Hadoop, an open source framework, to distribute your data and processing across a resizable cluster of Amazon EC2 instances. Customers launch millions of Amazon EMR clusters every year.

The sites are modeled after Stack Overflow, a forum for computer programming questions that was the original site in this network.
name: Stack Exchange

description: statsd is a simple daemon for easy stats aggregation developed by Etsy.
name: statsd

description: Apache Storm is a free and open source distributed realtime computation system. Storm makes it easy to reliably process unbounded streams of data, doing for realtime processing what Hadoop did for batch processing. Can be used with any programming language, and is a lot of fun to use! Predominantly written in Clojure. Originally by BackType acquired by Twitter.
name: Storm

description:
Payments for Platforms. Stripe is a developer-friendly way to accept payments online and in mobile apps.
We process billions of dollars a year for thousands of companies of all sizes.
name: Stripe

description: Apache Struts is an open-source web application framework for developing Java EE web applications. It uses and extends the Java Servlet API to encourage developers to adopt a model–view–controller (MVC) architecture.
name: Struts

description: SVN is an open-source revision control system, which aims to be a compelling replacement for CVS.
name: Subversion

description: Summingbird is a library that lets you write streaming MapReduce programs that look like native Scala or Java collection transformations and execute them on a number of well-known distributed MapReduce platforms like Storm and Scalding.

description: Synapse is Airbnb's new system for service discovery. Synapse solves the problem of automated fail-over in the cloud, where failover via network re-configuration is impossible. The end result is the ability to connect internal services together in a scalable, fault-tolerant way.
name: Synapse

description: Tableau produces a family of interactive data visualization products focused on business intelligence.

Originally developed by Facebook
name: Thrift

description: Zoie is a high-throughput real-time search indexing system based on the Lucene search library. The real-time indexing provides users the ability to search almost instantly for content that is updated in real time. The index is persisted on disk and if there is a system crash, the index does not need to be completely rebuilt.
name: Zoie
